message: fix: dont treat as dead when SSL test failed
refactor(proxy-checker): rename ProxyChecker1 to ProxyCheckerPublicIP
fix(lock): update FileLockHelper usage to remove non-blocking option

fix(lock): make file locking non-blocking and update callers/tests

- Use LOCK_NB in `src/PhpProxyHunter/FileLockHelper.php::lock()` so attempts to
  acquire an already-held lock return false immediately instead of blocking.
- Update backend callers to the non-blocking behavior:
  - `php_backend/check-http-proxy.php` -> use `lock(LOCK_NB)` and remove redundant `_log_shared(...)`
  - `php_backend/check-https-proxy.php` -> use `lock(LOCK_NB)`
- Add tests in `tests/PhpProxyHunter/FileLockHelperTest.php`:
  - `testLockFailsIfAlreadyLocked`
  - `testLockFailsIfAlreadyExists`
- Minor CLI demo comment/formatting tweak.

No breaking API changes expected; this prevents scripts/tests from hanging when locks are held.

feat(checkers): use FileLockHelper, add stale-lock handling, ensure log dirs

- Replace manual fopen/flock locking with Composer-autoloaded PhpProxyHunter\FileLockHelper.
- Detect and remove stale CLI lock files older than 1 hour; write PID/timestamp JSON to new lock files for diagnostics.
- Ensure nested log directories are created (tmp/logs/{checker}/{hash}.txt) in get_log_file_shared.
- Normalize request parsing, CORS, content-type, and explicit max execution time (300s).
- Unify hash filename generation for web/CLI runs and redirect runner output to `.txt` logs for frontend consumption.
- Misc: small refactors and clearer comments/messages in HTTP/HTTPS checker flows.

This reduces duplication, improves lock reliability, and makes logs discoverable by the frontend.
refactor: replace echo with respond_text for usage output
refactor: update lock file paths to use '/locks/' directory

refactor(checker): use getPhpExecutable() for runner and normalize cli hashFilename

- Use `getPhpExecutable(true)` instead of the hardcoded `'php'` when building the background runner command to improve portability (Windows/Env-specific PHP).
- Normalize the fallback hash filename for CLI runs from `"$currentScriptFilename/cli.txt"` to `"$currentScriptFilename/cli"` (remove `.txt` suffix).
- Files changed: `php_backend/check-http-proxy.php`, `php_backend/check-https-proxy.php`.

Note: This is a maintenance/refactor change. The hash/filename format used for logs/runners has been adjusted — update any external tooling or integrations that depend on the previous `cli.txt` naming if needed.

refactor: move php_exec() to dedicated utility file

- Removed php_exec() from func.php
- Added new file src/utils/process/php_exec.php containing the function
- Improved project structure by isolating process-related utilities

refactor: remove getPhpBinaryPath() and normalize comment style

- Deleted unused getPhpBinaryPath() function
- Moved inline end-of-line comments onto their own lines for clarity
- No behavioral changes to existing logic
fix(logs): restrict log path visibility to admins only

refactor(checker): standardize log filenames to .txt and simplify shared helpers

- Use `.txt` for output log files instead of `.out` (php_backend/check-http-proxy.php, check-https-proxy.php).
- Normalize hash filename format (use "$currentScriptFilename/$user" and "$currentScriptFilename/cli.txt" fallback).
- Use `$hashFilename` directly for log labels (remove string replace on `$currentScriptFilename`).
- Adjust globals in check functions to remove unused `$currentScriptFilename`.
- Simplify `checker-runner.php` helpers (streamline `get_log_file_shared` / `_log_shared` implementations; remove extra wrapper guards and minor formatting).
- No changes to the proxy-checking algorithms; this is a maintenance/refactor change.

Note: Update any external tooling or scripts that expect the old `.out` log filenames or the previous hash format (`-` style) if necessary. No breaking API changes expected.

fix(logs): use read_file and improve missing/unreadable log diagnostics

- Replace suppressed `@file_get_contents()` with `read_file()` for consistent file access and better error handling.
- Print clearer messages when logs are missing or unreadable and include the log file path to aid debugging.
- Normalize message punctuation for consistency.

No breaking changes.

feat(checker): extract shared checker-runner + add HTTP log viewer

- Add: php_backend/checker-runner.php
  - get_log_file_shared(string $hashFilename)
  - _log_shared(string $hashFilename, ...$args)
  - load_proxies_for_mode($file, $proxy, $mode, $proxy_db)
- Update: php_backend/check-http-proxy.php
  - require checker-runner, replace local get_log_file/_log with shared helpers
  - use load_proxies_for_mode('http', ...)
  - use get_log_file_shared/_log_shared
- Update: php_backend/check-https-proxy.php
  - require checker-runner, replace local get_log_file/_log with shared helpers
  - use load_proxies_for_mode('https', ...)
  - use get_log_file_shared/_log_shared
- Update: src/react/pages/ProxyList/LogViewer.tsx
  - change log fetch path to use `check-*-proxy/{hash}`
  - add HTTP tab, polling, and fetchHttpProxyCheckerResult()

BREAKING CHANGE: log URL/hash format changed from `check-*-proxy-<hash>` to `check-*-proxy/<hash>`. Update any external callers or integrations that rely on the old path.
refactor(proxy-submission): simplify _checkProxy2 by removing try/catch and adding http/https proxy checks
fix(check): update proxy status to 'dead' when not active

feat(proxy): unify per-proxy logging and adjust HTTP checker protocols

- remove 'https' from protocols in `check-http-proxy.php` (keep http, socks4, socks5)
- add a friendly per-proxy summary log line in `check-http-proxy.php`:
  - includes status symbol ([OK]/[--]), protocols, and latency
- add a consolidated per-proxy summary log line in `check-https-proxy.php`:
  - includes status symbol ([OK]/[--]), protocols, and latency (uses max latency)
- keep existing DB updates and behavior unchanged; logging improved for easier reading and tooling

Notes:
- Latency formatting printed in seconds (rounded to 2 decimals) to match existing log style.
- Logging changes are cosmetic and intended to aid operators and automated parsers.
refactor(check-http-proxy): comment out starting verbose logging

refactor(php_backend): remove unused $url/$webTitle and simplify check() signature

- Remove unused top-level variables `$url` and `$webTitle` from `php_backend/check-http-proxy.php`.
- Update call site to invoke `check($proxy)` instead of `check($proxy, $url, $webTitle)`.
- Change `check()` function signature and docblock to accept only `string $proxy`.
- Cleanup only: no behavioral changes expected, just removal of unused parameters/vars to reduce warnings and improve clarity.
refactor(check-https-proxy): improve code clarity with comments for proxy handling and process setup

fix(checker): remove HTTPS/SSL handling from ProxyCheckerHttpOnly

- Exclude 'https' from the default protocols list.
- Remove test URL scheme replacement for HTTPS.
- Stop setting $result->isSSL for HTTPS responses.
- Keep HTTP and SOCKS checking logic unchanged.

Files: src/PhpProxyHunter/Checker/ProxyCheckerHttpOnly.php

fix(checker): test all proxy protocols instead of stopping at first success

Remove the `$http_ok` flag and the early `break` so the checker continues
through the full protocol list. This change allows collecting all
working protocol types (`workingTypes[]`) per proxy while preserving
latency aggregation.
fix(check-http-proxy): change delimiter from comma to hyphen for workingTypes

refactor(deploy): consolidate SSH/SFTP helpers and add backend-only path

Refactor `bin/deploy-vps.mjs` by extracting shared SSH/SFTP utilities (`createSftp`, `useSftp`, `withSSH`)
and simplifying SFTP operations (`uploadFile`, `uploadDir`, `writeRemoteFile`, `deleteRemotePath`) to use them.
Streamline `execWithBashrc`, `gitPull`, and `shell_exec` to reuse the SSH helper and reduce boilerplate.

Also:
- Add a `--backend` / `--backend-only` deploy path that creates a remote lock, runs `git pull`, runs `bash bin/fix-perm`, and removes the lock.
- Simplify and normalize error handling and logging across deploy steps (shorter error messages and truthy checks).
- Clean up UI-only and full deploy flows (consistent lock handling, compact command invocations, and quieter delete fallbacks).

This change improves code reuse, reduces duplication, and makes backend-only deployments faster and safer.

refactor(eslint): improve clarity and structure of ESLint config comments

- Rewrote all inline comments to appear above their corresponding rules
- Expanded and clarified comment explanations throughout the config
- Added descriptive section headers for ignored files, globals, overrides, and rules
- Improved readability by restructuring comment placement without modifying logic
- Added comments for Prettier loading, FlatCompat initialization, and ESLint rule sets
feat(eslint): allow empty catch blocks in ESLint configuration

feat(deploy): add --backend flag for backend-only deploy

Add support for `--backend` / `--backend-only` to `bin/deploy-vps.mjs`.
When provided the script now:
- creates the remote build lock (`tmp/locks/.build-lock`),
- runs a `git pull` in the configured `remotePath`,
- runs `bash bin/fix-perm` on the remote to fix permissions,
- removes the lock and exits.

Reuses existing helpers (`gitPull`, `shell_exec`, `writeRemoteFile`, `deleteRemotePath`)
and short-circuits the full UI/build/deploy flow so composer/build/uploads are skipped.

fix(logviewer): make log URL and HTTPS UID responsive

- stack label and value on small screens (flex-col / sm:flex-row)
- allow monospace values to wrap or scroll (break-words, max-w-full, overflow-auto)
- prevents URL/UID text from overflowing the LogViewer panel on narrow viewports

feat(dashboard): add empty state and optimize UserPaymentLogs rendering

Compute visibleEntries once (filter + slice) and return a clear empty-state
when no payment-related entries exist. Refactor mapping to use visibleEntries
for readability and to avoid repeated filtering. Minor layout/formatting cleanup.

feat(dashboard): add Payment Activity tab and make header tabs scrollable on mobile

- import and register `UserActivityCard`; extend `activeTab` union to include 'payment'
- add new "Payment Activity" tab panel and move `UserPaymentLogs` into it
- make tab header horizontally scrollable on small screens (wrap in overflow-x-auto, use flex-nowrap/whitespace-nowrap)
- prevent tab buttons from shrinking (add flex-shrink-0) so tabs remain scrollable touch targets

fix(dashboard): make user activity table full-width to enable horizontal scrolling

Replace `inline-table` with `min-w-full table-auto` in UserActivityCard so the
table expands to the container width and horizontal overflow/scrolling works
correctly inside the activity panel.
fix(UserPaymentLogs): ensure safe string conversion for action types
feat(Navbar): add spacers to offset fixed navbar

feat(ui): show ISP brand icons in UserPaymentLogs

- add `src/react/utils/icons.ts` exporting `brandIcons` (im3, axis, unknown) and `statusIcons`
- update `src/react/pages/dashboard/UserPaymentLogs.tsx` to:
  - import `brandIcons` and compute `isp`/`iconSrc`
  - render circular brand image when available, fall back to `TX` badge
  - refine `payment.details` typing and use a typed lookup to avoid TS indexing errors
feat(img.php): add user-agent forwarding to cURL handle for improved request handling

refactor(img): use buildCurl helper for image proxy streaming

- Replace manual curl_init + curl_setopt_array with shared buildCurl(...) helper to centralize cURL configuration.
- Re-attach header and write callbacks to stream response to cache and client while enforcing MAX_BYTES.
- Preserve existing behaviors (follow redirects, timeouts, buffer size) by overriding only necessary options.
- Improve error reporting to include received byte count and requested URL for easier debugging.

feat(security): expand sensitive file extension blocking in Apache and Nginx configs

- Replace legacy Apache deny rules with `Require all denied`
- Add additional sensitive extensions to `.htaccess` FilesMatch list
- Update Nginx location block to match expanded sensitive extension set
- Improve consistency of security rules across both configurations
feat(img.php): add shared.php requirement for improved functionality
refactor(img.php): improve URL handling and add base64 validation function

feat(proxy): accept URL via POST/GET and preserve percent-encoding

- Read request body or query using `parseQueryOrPostBody()` and decode URL with `rawurldecode`, matching JS decodeURIComponent behavior.
- Validate the decoded URL with `filter_var` and a scheme check; return 400 for missing/invalid URLs.
- Normalize minor formatting and whitespace (cache constants alignment, header length variable).
- Move `send_error` implementation to the bottom to centralize error handling.

This adds support for percent-encoded URLs in both query and POST bodies and improves input validation.
refactor: replace ensure_dir calls with write_file for process logging

refactor: remove strict_types declarations and improve coding standards

- Remove `declare(strict_types=1)` from multiple PHP files
- Add and adjust PHP-CS-Fixer rules (brace positioning, whitespace, array spacing, EOF newline)
- Update variable names and formatting for consistency
- Improve indentation and alignment across project
- Add new proxy parsing test file
- Update phpcs exclusion patterns
- Minor code cleanup and comment alignment

feat(date): restructure timeAgo utility and add PHP version

- Updated JS imports to use new path `src/utils/date/timeAgo.js` in:
  - proxyManager-src.js
  - src/react/pages/ProxyList/index.tsx
- Renamed `src/utils/date.js` to `src/utils/date/timeAgo.js`
- Added new PHP implementation: `src/utils/date/timeAgo.php`

docs(shared.php): update PHPDoc and return value for refreshDbConnections

- Expand PHPDoc for `refreshDbConnections` to document additional global DB wrappers:
  `user_db`, `proxy_db`, and `log_db`.
- Update return annotation to an array shape describing `core_db`, `user_db`,
  `proxy_db`, and `log_db`.
- Add missing globals to the function (`$user_db`, `$proxy_db`, `$log_db`) so
  they are re-populated after re-instantiating `CoreDB`.
- Return the new DB wrapper instances as an associative array.

This clarifies function behaviour and types for static analysis and callers.

fix(executables): add PHP fallback to generate executables.json when Node fails

Try the Node.js `executables-finder.cjs` first; if Node is unavailable or the script fails,
call a new `generateExecutablesJson()` PHP fallback that probes `PHP_BINARY`, common system
and virtualenv locations and uses `which`/`where` as a last resort to locate `php` and `python`.
Write `src/utils/process/executables.json` instead of throwing a RuntimeException, preventing
a fatal error when Node isn't installed or the script cannot run.

refactor: move PHP-CS-Fixer scripts from src/dev to scripts directory

- Updated .php-cs-fixer.dist.php to load autoload.php from new scripts path
- Renamed src/dev/php-cs-fixer/ directory to scripts/php-cs-fixer/

feat(proxy-checker): test all protocol types and aggregate results

- Continue testing all configured proxy protocols (HTTP, HTTPS, SOCKS4, SOCKS5, etc.) instead of stopping on first success.
- Track and collect all successful `workingTypes`.
- Introduce `anonymityPriority` and aggregate the best anonymity level seen (transparent < anonymous < elite).
- Record the best (minimum) latency among successful attempts (`attemptLatency`) instead of overwriting on each loop.
- Keep transparent verification step (HTTP endpoint check) but continue to evaluate remaining types.

This improves detection accuracy by aggregating multiple working protocol types and selecting the best anonymity/latency metrics.
fix(proxy-checker): use getPhpExecutable for PHP command

fix(src/utils/process): make executables functions PHP 7.0 compatible and add optional escaping

- Remove nullable return type hints (?string) to support PHP 7.0.
- Add optional $escape parameter to `getPhpExecutable()` and `getPythonExecutable()`.
- When $escape is true, return an escaped path via `escapeshellcmd()`; otherwise preserve previous behavior.
feat(process): implement runCmdInBackground function for cross-platform command execution
feat(shared): add refreshDbConnections function to re-instantiate CoreDB and manage DB connections
feat(postinstall): add logging for executed post-install scripts

fix(scripts/composer-installer): handle HTTP streams, cleanup partial downloads, and exit cleanly

- Drain and consume non-200 responses to allow sockets to close.
- Add error handlers on file and response streams to destroy streams and remove partial downloads.
- Use robust HEAD handling: safely parse Content-Length (nullable) and consume the response.
- Remove partial files on request errors (use fs.unlinkSync defensively).
- Explicitly call process.exit(0) after successful install to prevent the Node process from hanging.

feat(process): add cross-platform executables finder for PHP and Python

- Include new `executables-finder.cjs` in postinstall script
- Add `.gitignore` entry for generated `executables.json`
- Implement Node-based executable resolution with Windows/NIX support
- Add PHP helper `executables.php` to load or generate executable paths
feat(geo-ip): add geo IP lookup functionality with proxy support

feat(checker): accept transparent proxies after verification

Treat proxies that return the client's IP as "transparent" but still usable
if they can successfully fetch a verification HTTP endpoint. The checker
now performs a lightweight cURL request through the same proxy/type/creds
and accepts the proxy (anonymity='transparent') when the endpoint returns
a 2xx-3xx response. Debug logs updated to show verification attempts and
outcomes. Also minor formatting tweak (move latency comment to its own line).

feat(startup): spawn post-check tasks (filterPorts, filterPortsDuplicate)

- remove unused global FileLockHelper instantiation
- after launching proxy checker processes, start `filterPorts.php` and `filterPortsDuplicate.php` in background
- pass per-script lock file paths and silence output (NUL or /dev/null)
- maintain Windows and POSIX-compatible background execution paths

Starts automated post-processing of ports once proxy checks are dispatched.

fix(proxyCheckerStarter): improve request parsing, captcha validation, proxy arg and add global lock

- import and instantiate FileLockHelper to track a global proxy-checker lock
- replace direct $_REQUEST usage with parseQueryOrPostBody() for safer request parsing
- strengthen captcha check to reject falsy values (empty or false)
- only include credentials in the --proxy argument when both username and password are non-empty (fall back to proxy string otherwise)

This prevents passing empty credentials, makes request handling more robust, and prepares for centralized locking of proxy checks.

refactor(filter-ports): simplify CLI detection, improve file handling, and streamline proxy processing

- Replace manual CLI detection with `is_cli()` for clarity and reuse.
- Normalize variable setup and reorganize admin/max settings logic.
- Introduce `$scriptName` for cleaner lock file path generation.
- Improve lock and status file handling using `write_file()` for consistency.
- Rename shutdown function to `filterPortsExitProcess` to avoid collisions and improve clarity.
- Simplify reading untested proxies and merging fallback proxy sources.
- Replace redundant iterator setup with more concise conversion and iteration.
- Improve proxy validation loop by reducing repeated array indexing.
- Preserve all existing logic and behavior while improving readability and maintainability.

refactor(filterPortsDuplicate): clean formatting and improve log messages

Simplify whitespace and comment placement; replace terse reason tags with clear, human-readable log messages for deleted, kept, updated, and skipped proxies.
refactor(geoIp): replace file_put_contents with write_file

feat(proxy-checker): refactor starter script for clarity, session handling, and process management

- Add minor formatting improvements and initialize Windows detection earlier.
- Consolidate session key usage for proxy check cooldown logic.
- Improve proxy selection flow with fallback to oldest tested proxies.
- Simplify proxy extraction and variable usage (`$proxyStr`, `$processId`).
- Reorganize runner, log, and lock directory paths for consistency.
- Replace manual file preparation with `write_file()` and cleaner permission handling.
- Build command using array-based parts for better readability and safety.
- Improve background process execution logic for both Windows and Unix systems.

refactor(proxy-checker): initialize CoreDB and rebuild DB connections to prevent conflicts

- Introduce CoreDB usage and set up fresh instances for user_db, proxy_db, and log_db
- Remove existing global DB handles and trigger garbage collection to avoid connection clashes
- Update globals to include new DB-related variables
- Minor formatting adjustments and comment clarifications in timeout refresh and file-writing sections

refactor(proxy-list): optimize timezone-missing proxy selection with memoized candidates

- Introduce `candidatesToUpdate` using `useMemo` to avoid recalculating filtered proxies
- Replace inline filtering/sorting logic inside `useEffect`
- Remove unnecessary early proxy length check and inner helper function
- Simplify loop and enqueue logic before running scheduler
feat(server): add cache headers and improve documentation for caching

feat(geoip): improve robustness and return values for GeoIpHelper

- Change `resolveGeoProxy` to always return an array; return `[]` on empty input.
- Replace `list()` with safer parsing using `$parts` and null-coalescing behavior.
- Ensure resolved geo data is returned at end of `resolveGeoProxy`.
- Update docblocks with correct return type information.
- Remove strict type hint from `getGeoIpSimple` to allow more flexible input.

chore(lint): remove non-existent Slevomat rule ref from phpcs.xml

Remove the SlevomatCodingStandard.Namespaces.UnderscoreInName rule block which
could cause PHPCS to fail when the sniff is not installed. Keep naming-related
exclusions but avoid referencing a sniff that may not exist in all environments.
feat(geoip): enhance getGeoIpSimple() documentation and include city information in response
feat(geoip): include city information in getGeoIpSimple() response
feat(geoip): add language information to getGeoIpSimple() response

refactor(geoplugin): modernize class structure, docs, and data handling

- Add updated class-level PHPDoc with clearer descriptions.
- Improve property PHPDoc blocks and expand metadata coverage.
- Refactor `locate()` to simplify flow, reduce duplication, and improve resilience.
- Add early returns and safer fallbacks for JSON and serialized responses.
- Enhance recursive lookup with cleaner GeoPlugin2 integration.
- Modernize `fetch()` with clearer caching logic and consolidated cURL/fopen paths.
- Improve error messages and maintain consistent formatting across methods.
- Update convert(), nearby(), and fromGeoIp2CityModel() with stricter validation and reduced redundancy.

chore(lint): disable camelCase naming sniffs in phpcs.xml

Add exclusions for Generic, Squiz and Slevomat naming sniffs to allow non-camelcase
identifiers (functions, variables, classes, properties). Also lower severity for
SlevomatCodingStandard.Namespaces.UnderscoreInName.

- Exclude Generic.NamingConventions.CamelCapsFunctionName
- Exclude Generic.NamingConventions.CamelCapsVariableName
- Exclude Squiz.NamingConventions.ValidFunctionName
- Exclude Squiz.NamingConventions.ValidVariableName
- Exclude Squiz.Classes.ValidClassName
- Exclude SlevomatCodingStandard.NamingConventions.UnderscoreSeparated
- Exclude SlevomatCodingStandard.NamingConventions.ValidClassName
- Exclude SlevomatCodingStandard.NamingConventions.ValidFunctionName
- Exclude SlevomatCodingStandard.NamingConventions.ValidVariableName
- Set severity 0 for SlevomatCodingStandard.Namespaces.UnderscoreInName
feat(vscode): update PHP CS Fixer settings for enhanced configuration
fix(geo-plugin): handle generic exceptions in locate method

refactor(geoip): simplify getGeoIpSimple() data extraction and add debug field

- Remove conditional checks and assign fields directly from GeoPlugin result
- Add `debug` field using jsonSerialize() for improved diagnostics

fix(geo-plugin): suppress JsonSerializable return type deprecation

Add #[\ReturnTypeWillChange] attribute to GeoPlugin::jsonSerialize() to
temporarily silence the PHP deprecation notice about the JsonSerializable
return type compatibility.

refactor(geoip): rename getGeoIp() to resolveGeoProxy() and update all call sites

- Replace all usages of `GeoIpHelper::getGeoIp()` with `GeoIpHelper::resolveGeoProxy()`
- Update method name and docblock in `GeoIpHelper`
- Apply minor formatting and comment cleanups across proxy processing functions
feat(geo-plugin): add getGeoIpSimple method to retrieve basic geo information

fix(geo-plugin): write MMDB downloads to temp file and move atomically

Write downloaded GeoLite2 MMDB files to a temporary file first (using
sys_get_temp_dir()/tempnam) and then move to the final destination to
avoid partial/corrupt files. Use atomic rename() with a copy+unlink
fallback across filesystems, ensure destination directory exists, and
improve error logging. This prevents concurrent/partial-write issues.

feat(server/respond): accept optional HTTP status in response helpers

- Add optional int $status parameter (default 200) to respond_json(), respond_text(), and respond_html().
- Use http_response_code($status) so helpers set the HTTP status; attempt to set code even if headers were already sent.
- Add file-level doc comment documenting the new parameter and behavior.

No breaking changes — defaults preserve previous behavior (200).

feat(php-cs-fixer): add dynamic custom fixer loading and introduce no-multiple-statements-per-line fallback

- Replace direct GlobalOneLineFixer include with autoload loader
- Add conditional registration of fixers based on availability in PhpCsFixer
- Introduce CustomNoMultipleStatementsPerLineFixer with full logic for safe statement splitting
- Update GlobalOneLineFixer formatting for cleaner loops
- Add .gitignore for test input in php-cs-fixer directory
- Add direct-test.cjs script for local debugging and validation of fixer behavior
chore(kills.cmd): clean up php and node

refactor(cs-fixer): rename GlobalOneLineFixer namespace to PhpCsFixerCustom

- Change namespace from `CustomFixer` to `PhpCsFixerCustom` in `GlobalOneLineFixer.php`.
- Update formatting in `applyFix` (loop headers reflowed across multiple lines).
feat(autoload): add autoload file to require custom fixer files
style(shared.php): format database connection variable declarations for consistency

feat(cs-fixer): add GlobalOneLineFixer and enable rule

Add a new custom PHP-CS-Fixer (`Custom/global_one_line`) to convert
multi-line `global` statements into a single-line form.

- Add `src/dev/php-cs-fixer/GlobalOneLineFixer.php` implementing token-based
  conversion.
- Require and register the fixer in `.php-cs-fixer.dist.php`.
- Refactor config to build `$rules` and enable `'Custom/global_one_line' => true`.
fix(check-http-proxy): remove unnecessary SSL data from response

fix(geo): prevent concurrent GeoMMDB downloads in GeoPlugin2

- add private static `$downloadingMap` to track active downloads
- guard `downloadFile()` to skip if the target path is already being downloaded
- mark path in `$downloadingMap` and register shutdown handler to clear it

This prevents duplicate concurrent downloads for the same GeoIP file.

feat(scripts): add geoip-installer and update download logic

- add `scripts/geoip-installer.js` to fetch GeoLite2 MMDB files:
  - follows redirects for HEAD/GET, reads Content-Length
  - downloads only when remote size is larger than local (or when local missing)
  - writes to `tmp/download` then copies to `src/`
  - robust error handling, cleans partial files and ensures process exits when done
- include `geoip-installer.js` in `scripts/postinstall.js` to run after install
- change download behavior in `src/PhpProxyHunter/GeoPlugin2.php` to only download when
  remote size is greater than local (`$remoteFileSize > $localFileSize`)

This adds automatic GeoIP MMDB management and tightens update conditions to avoid unnecessary downloads.

feat(timeago): add `simple` and `unitOnly` options; use compact output in ProxyList

Add optional parameters to `timeAgo(dateString, simple = false, unitOnly = false)`:
- `simple=true` shortens output: when days > 0 show days and hours (hide minutes & seconds); when hours > 0 (and days === 0) hide seconds only.
- Minutes-as-top-unit still include seconds (e.g. "2 minutes 10 seconds"), seconds-only unchanged.
- `unitOnly=true` uses short unit labels (d/h/m/s), e.g. "1d 3h ago".

Update `src/react/pages/ProxyList/index.tsx` to call `timeAgo(proxy.last_check, true, true)` so last-check times render in the compact form.

No breaking changes (defaults remain `false`).

fix(php): make codebase PHP 7.0 compatible and tidy function signatures

- Remove PHP 7.1+/8.0-only type syntax (nullable `?type` and some return `: void`) so code runs on PHP 7.0.
- Replace `str_starts_with` usage with `strpos(... ) === 0` for compatibility.
- Remove `setCacheHeaders(5)` call in `artisan/proxyWorkingBackground.php` and normalize `exitProcess()` formatting.
- Normalize function signatures and minor cleanup in:
  - `func.php`
  - `proxyCheckerParallel-func.php`
  - `src/PhpProxyHunter/utils/validator.php`
  - `src/utils/file/sanitizer.php`
  - `src/utils/string/index.php`
- Ensure no duplicate/malformed declarations remain; verified syntax with `php -l`.

BREAKING CHANGE: Several function signatures had type hints removed (parameters/return types). Callers that relied on strict type enforcement should be reviewed.

refactor(file): move createParentFolders() to mkdir utils module

- Remove createParentFolders() from func.php
- Add createParentFolders() to src/utils/file/mkdir.php
- No functional changes; improve file organization and modularity

refactor(file): move permission helper functions to dedicated utils module

- Remove setMultiPermissions() and setPermissions() from func.php
- Add new file src/utils/file/permissions.php containing the extracted functions
- No functional changes; code is reorganized for better structure and maintainability
fix: suppress warnings on file permission changes and file writes
fix(proxy-checker): organize runner and PID files into dedicated directories
fix(runBashOrBatch): organize runner and log file paths into dedicated directories

fix(bin): prefer venv over .venv when selecting/creating virtual environment

Prefer `venv` by default and fall back to `.venv` in `bin/py` and `bin/py.cmd`.
Retains existing venv creation, python3 shim, activation, and OS-specific behavior.
Files changed: bin/py, bin/py.cmd

fix(proxy-list): preserve cache on embed.php JSON parse failure

Only update the in-memory and localStorage caches when the fetched result is a valid, non-empty array.
If fetch or JSON parsing fails (or the response is empty/invalid), fall back to the existing module cache or localStorage
so the UI doesn't get cleared when `embed.php` returns invalid JSON.
chore: restore old proxy list using static file
feat(ProxyDB): add findProxy method for flexible proxy searching with pagination
fix(proxy-add): correct tmp() usage for lock file path

refactor(utils/file): extract tmp() into dedicated temp.php

- Move `tmp(...)` helper out of `src/utils/file/index.php` into new
  `src/utils/file/temp.php`.
- Keeps `index.php` focused on general file utilities and isolates temp
  directory creation/permission logic in a single file.
- No behavioral changes to `tmp(...)` (logic preserved).

fix(tmp): append filenames to tmp() result instead of passing them into tmp()

- Avoid passing filename-like args into `tmp()` (it creates directories named like the file).
- Use `tmp()` to obtain the directory and append the filename instead.

Reason: calling `tmp('locks/whatever.lock')` created a folder named `whatever.lock`, breaking lock-file behavior; this change ensures real lock files are used.
fix(FileLockHelper): delete the lock file gracefully upon unlocking
fix(proxy-add): add early exit if the lock is already acquired to prevent concurrent proxy additions

refactor(PhpProxyHunter/FileLockHelper): centralize lock-file handling and unify lock checks

- Add private `openLockHandle()` to ensure lock directory, check writability
  and open the lock file (suppressing fopen warnings).
- Refactor `lock()` to reuse the new helper and properly close handles on failure.
- Replace `isLockedByAnotherProcess()` with a single `isLocked()` implementation
  that attempts an exclusive non-blocking `flock` to detect active locks and
  falls back to `file_exists()` when the file can't be opened.
- Update CLI demo to call `isLocked()` and update unit tests to use the new API.
- Improve error handling around directory creation/opening to avoid noisy PHP warnings.
fix(FileLockHelper): improve directory creation and locking logic to handle errors gracefully
refactor(proxyAdd): simplify proxy addition logic by including proxy-add.php directly

refactor(react): move ProxyList into its own folder and update imports

- rename: src/react/pages/ProxyList.tsx -> src/react/pages/ProxyList/index.tsx
- Adjust relative import paths to reflect new location (types, utils, components).
- Update route import in `src/react/routes.js` to `./pages/ProxyList/index.tsx`.
- Internal component imports updated to use local filenames (ApiUsage, LogViewer, ModifyCurl, ProxySubmission).
- No functional or behavior changes intended; purely file structure / import path cleanup.

feat(deploy): add UI-only deploy flag and pass-through args for Windows script

- Add passthrough of command-line arguments to `bin/deploy-vps.cmd` so forwarded args are available to the Node script.
- Implement `--ui` / `--ui-only` handling in `bin/deploy-vps.mjs`:
  - Build local React UI (`yarn build:react`) and upload `dist/react` + `index.html`.
  - Remove remote `dist/react` and `index.html` (best-effort) before upload.
  - Create and remove a lightweight build lock at `tmp/locks/.build-lock` to signal maintenance.
  - Run remote permission fix (`bash bin/fix-perm`) and error on failure.
  - Skip full deploy when UI-only flow completes.

feat(codeblock): add Vite-safe on-demand highlight.js language loaders and demo

- Add explicit Vite-compatible `languageLoaders` map and `loadLanguage` helper to dynamically import/register highlight.js languages (with common aliases).
- Update `CodeBlock` to lazy-load only the requested language, use SSR guard and an `active` flag, avoid bulk preloads, and simplify DOM update logic; small classname tweak.
- Add `src/react/pages/examples/HighlightJS.tsx` – example page rendering multiple `CodeBlock` samples (JS, TS, Python, Bash, PowerShell, Ruby, JSON, CSS, SCSS, HTML/XML, YAML, Markdown, DOS).
- Include aliases such as sh/shell/zsh, tsx/mts/cts, ps/ps1, rb/gemspec/podspec/thor/irb, dos/bat/cmd.

style(buttons): remove shadow utilities from button classNames

Remove Tailwind `shadow` and `dark:shadow-white` utilities from button and link
`className` attributes to disable drop shadows while keeping other styles intact.

fix(codeblock): replace react-syntax-highlighter with runtime highlight.js to fix prod build errors

- remove `react-syntax-highlighter` and its types from `package.json`
- replace static `react-syntax-highlighter` usage in `src/react/components/CodeBlock.tsx`
  with a runtime/dynamic import of `highlight.js/lib/core` and language packs
- register languages at runtime and set `code` element `textContent`, then call
  `hljs.highlightElement` (avoids innerHTML/unescaped HTML and build-time lexical init issues)
- switch markup back to a simple <pre><code ref=...> wrapper and import GitHub dark CSS
- purpose: fix production bundling error ("can't access lexical declaration ... before initialization")
  and prevent white/blank page on build

BREAKING CHANGE: removed `react-syntax-highlighter` dependency — CI/devs should run installs and verify builds.

feat(codeblock): replace manual highlight.js with react-syntax-highlighter

Replace the previous manual hljs usage in `CodeBlock` with the
`react-syntax-highlighter` Light build and `atomOneDark` HLJS theme.
Register multiple languages (javascript, jsx, html/xml, css, scss,
java, python, typescript) and render code via <SyntaxHighlighter>
(showLineNumbers, wrapLongLines). Remove the useRef/useEffect hljs
highlightElement flow and update markup from <pre><code> to the new
SyntaxHighlighter wrapper.

Adds dependencies:
- react-syntax-highlighter@^16.1.0
- @types/react-syntax-highlighter@^15.5.13

No breaking API changes expected.

feat(react): add Highlight.js example page and route

Add a new example page `src/react/pages/examples/HighlightJS.tsx` that demonstrates the existing
`CodeBlock` with highlight.js and dark/light-friendly styling. Register and import the new
component in `src/react/index.tsx` and add a route for `/examples/highlightjs`.

feat(recaptcha): check session expiry before executing recaptcha

- Import `checkRecaptchaSessionExpired` and use it to verify whether the
  recaptcha session has expired before calling `recaptchaRef.current?.executeAsync()`.
- Prevent unnecessary recaptcha executions by only calling `verifyRecaptcha`
  when the session is expired.

This reduces redundant recaptcha calls and centralizes session-expiry logic.

fix(security): strictly validate captcha and block unauthorized access

- Treat a false captcha session as unresolved in `embed.php` by changing the check
  from `empty($_SESSION['captcha'])` to `empty($_SESSION['captcha']) || !$_SESSION['captcha']`.
- Add an early server-side guard in `php_backend/proxy-working.php` that returns
  a JSON error ("Access denied") when the captcha session is missing or falsy.

This prevents access bypass when `$_SESSION['captcha']` is present but false
and enforces captcha validation for proxy-related endpoints.

fix(router): use useLocation for SPA titles & analytics

Move BrowserRouter to root so React Router hooks run inside a Router.
Import and use useLocation in MainApp and make the pageview/title effect
depend on location.pathname. Support routes with array paths when resolving
titles, send GA pageviews with the SPA path, and simplify reCAPTCHA
invocation to call verifyRecaptcha directly. Remove the redundant hardcoded
`document.title` in `src/react/pages/Login.tsx`.
fix(recaptcha): make token parameter optional in verifyRecaptcha function

style(ui): add dark-mode shadows (dark:shadow-white) to components

Add `dark:shadow-white` alongside existing Tailwind `shadow*` utilities so UI shadows remain visible in dark mode.
This is a cosmetic styling change only — no runtime or API behavior modified.

Notes:
- Purpose: improve shadow contrast in dark theme for better visual clarity.
- Verification: run the dev server and visually inspect key pages in dark mode.
feat(matcher): add case-insensitive string equality check function

feat(server): add unified response helpers for JSON, text, and HTML outputs

Introduced respond.php with utility functions:
- respond_json() for JSON responses with proper headers
- respond_text() for plain text responses
- respond_html() for HTML responses

Each function ensures correct Content-Type handling and terminates execution after output.

feat(user-payment-logs): add explicit filtering logic for package and payment action types

Added a secondary filter to ensure only entries with valid `action_type` values are displayed.
Now allows:
- `payment.action_type === 'PAYMENT'`
- `package_buy.action_type === 'PACKAGE_BUY'`

Also included commented debug variables for future inspection.
fix(FileLockHelper): change filePath visibility to public and improve lock acquisition message

refactor(file): extract path and mkdir helpers; make ensure_dir variadic and add ensure_dirs

- move `unixPath` into `src/utils/file/path.php`
- move `ensure_dir` and new `ensure_dirs` helpers into `src/utils/file/mkdir.php`
- remove the duplicated helper implementations from `src/utils/file/index.php`
- `ensure_dir` now accepts variadic path segments, normalizes/join paths, preserves absolute roots,
  creates directories recursively and returns the created path or false
- `ensure_dirs` provides bulk creation, accepting strings or arrays of segments and returning an indexed map of results

This reorganizes utility functions for clearer separation of concerns and adds improved path handling and multi-directory creation.

feat(file): make ensure_dir accept variadic path segments and add ensure_dirs helper

- update `ensure_dir` to accept variadic segments (`...$segments`), normalize and join
  path segments, collapse duplicate separators, handle Windows/Unix roots, create the
  directory recursively, and return the resulting path or false on failure.
- add new `ensure_dirs(...$dirs)` helper to create multiple directories in one call.
  Each argument may be a string path or an array of segments; returns an indexed map
  of results (created path or false).

This improves path handling and convenience for creating one or many directories.

fix(proxy-checker): use project tmp, ensure output dir and fix Windows runner

- use `tmp()` for runner/pid paths (avoid `__DIR__/tmp`)
- ensure output directory exists before redirecting (`ensure_dir(dirname($output_file))`)
- write platform-specific runner command (use `start "" /B` on Windows, background+`echo $!` on Unix)
- normalize runner identifier to `proxy-checker` for `runBashOrBatch`
- prefer `venv/Scripts/activate.bat` on Windows in `runBashOrBatch` to correctly locate venv activation

fix(proxy): limit large proxy result sets to prevent memory exhaustion

Limit the number of rows fetched from the proxies table to avoid loading
very large result sets into PHP memory. Use a conservative sample size:
- `getUntestedProxies(1000)` in `php_backend/proxy-checker.php`
- `getWorkingProxies(5000)` in `func-proxy.php`

This prevents "Allowed memory size exhausted" errors on large databases
while remaining a low-risk, backward-compatible change. Sizes are tunable
if different sampling is desired.

fix(proxy-list): conditionally start background checker based on processes.php output

- Replace unconditional `processes.php` fetch with a text response check.
- Only call `artisan/proxyCheckerStarter.php` when the response indicates "no running".
- Preserve the 5-minute throttle using `lastProxyCheckStart` in localStorage.
- Add error handling via `.catch(noop)` to keep behavior resilient.

This prevents unnecessary starter calls when the background checker is already running.

feat(proxy-list): switch to server-side pagination and return meta from getWorkingProxies

- Add serverTotal and serverTotalPages state to track server-side totals.
- Update fetchAndSetProxies to accept (page, per) and consume `{ data, meta }` from the backend; persist only the data in localStorage.
- Change getWorkingProxies signature to return `{ data: any[], meta: any | null }` and handle page/perPage, meta, and 403/error cases.
- Use server-provided totalPages for pagination (totalPages = serverTotalPages) and display serverTotal in the UI.
- Replace client-side slice pagination with server-driven paging and add an effect to refetch when page or rowsPerPage change.
- Refactor pagination UI into a responsive three-column layout: total (left), page controls (center), rows-per-page (right).

Notes:
- Preserves previous sorting (last_check desc) when randomize is false; prepared to accept backend `meta.total` and `meta.totalPages`.
- Local caching now stores only the `data` array to avoid storing meta alongside results.

feat(proxy): add paginated proxy-working API and client parsing

- Add `php_backend/proxy-working.php` endpoint that returns `{ data, meta }`
  and supports pagination (page, perPage/limit), randomize flag, and safe
  defaults/caps (DEFAULT_PER_PAGE=100, MAX_PER_PAGE=1000).
- Extend `ProxyDB::getWorkingProxies()` to accept `randomize`, `page`, `perPage`
  and to order by `last_check DESC` when `randomize=false`; preserves legacy
  single-argument `$limit` behavior for backward compatibility.
- Update React `ProxyList` to call `/php_backend/proxy-working.php` with
  page/perPage/randomize parameters, parse the `{data,meta}` response, and
  retain existing client-side transformations and caching.

Notes: server enforces per-page caps and safe defaults to prevent large payloads.
feat(proxy-add): change response handling to process text instead of JSON
feat(proxy-check): notify server on proxy check

feat(proxy-add): add robust locking, JSON errors and optional merge to proxies.txt

- unify and refactor proxy add logic in `php_backend/proxy-add.php` and `proxyAdd.php`
- return early with 400 + JSON when request body is empty
- acquire `FileLockHelper` earlier and fail fast if lock can't be obtained
- persist per-user `assets/proxies/added-<user>.txt`, append new proxies, then remove empty/duplicate lines
- when `proxyChecker.lock` exists, also append new proxies into `proxies.txt` (merge/backup)
- switch to consistent JSON responses and small code cleanup (shared include, clearer flow)

feat(proxy-add): add file locking, parse and normalize added proxies, return JSON responses

- Add `FileLockHelper` usage and per-user lock file to prevent concurrent writes.
- Return JSON responses and set `Content-Type: application/json` for API consistency.
- Normalize incoming data by extracting valid proxies, converting `Proxy` objects to text
  (using their string representation), appending them to per-user added file, and
  cleaning the file by removing empty and duplicate lines.
- Improve error handling: respond with informative JSON messages when no valid proxies
  are found or when another process holds the lock.
- Minor style/formatting: compact function declaration `function get_ports() {`.

Why:
- Prevent race conditions when multiple requests add proxies simultaneously.
- Ensure stored proxies are normalized and deduplicated.
- Make API behavior clearer for clients with JSON responses.

feat(proxy): add __toString to Proxy and enhance test output

- Add magic __toString() to `src/PhpProxyHunter/Proxy.php` to return a compact
  textual representation in the form `proxy@user:pass`. Omits empty username/
  password parts (returns just `proxy` if username missing, empty string if all
  fields empty).
- Keep `toJson()` unchanged; __toString is safe and returns a string even on
  failure.
- Update `tests/extractProxy.php` to print additional debug/info output:
  - Total extracted proxies count.
  - Example JSON transformation via `toJson(true, true)`.
  - Example text transformation via `(string) $extract[0]`.
- Adjust function formatting in `tests/extractProxy.php` (`function get_ports() {`).

Why:
- Improve developer ergonomics when casting `Proxy` objects to string or
  concatenating them in logs/tests, and provide richer test output for manual
  verification.

Notes:
- Behavior: (string)$proxy now yields one of:
  - "" (if proxy, username, password all empty)
  - "proxy" (if username missing)
  - "proxy@user" (if password missing)
  - "proxy@user:pass" (if both present)
- No breaking changes to existing serialization (`toJson()`).
feat(proxyAdd): enable CORS support by using Server::allowCors method

feat(file-lock): add release() convenience method to FileLockHelper

Add a public `release(): void` method to `FileLockHelper` that delegates to
`unlock()`. This provides a clearer, intention-revealing API for releasing
locks and improves readability for callers.

refactor(checkPorts): remove helper and use direct output buffering check

Remove the `is_output_buffering_active()` helper from `func.php` and update
`cidr-information/checkPorts.php` to call `ob_get_length() !== false`
directly when deciding to flush output buffers. Also normalize function
brace formatting for `checkIp` and `exitProcess`.

This reduces indirection and slightly cleans up style without changing logic.

refactor(utils): move isDateRFC3339OlderThanHours from func.php to utils

Extracted the isDateRFC3339OlderThanHours helper from `func.php` into a new
utility file `src/PhpProxyHunter/utils/date_rfc_3339.php`.

This keeps core functions organized under `src/PhpProxyHunter/utils` and
prepares the codebase for easier reuse and testing of date-related helpers.

No functional changes to the implementation were made.

fix(php-cs-fixer): avoid CLI-path override warning by setting Finder conditionally

Only set the PHP-CS-Fixer Finder from the configuration when no explicit
(non-option) path arguments are provided on the command line. This prevents
the "Paths from configuration file have been overridden by paths provided as
command arguments." warning when running `php-cs-fixer fix <path>`.

- detect non-option CLI args and skip $config->setFinder($finder) when present
- keep existing rules and parallel-config guard unchanged

feat(utils,curl): add realpath helper and enhance DebugSession logging

- add file/path.py with realpath(path) -> Optional[str] and export it from utils.file and utils
- enhance curl/DebugSession:
  - add ZoneInfo (Asia/Jakarta) with fallback timezone
  - prefix logs with RFC3339 timestamps
  - add _write_output to print and persist logs via proxy_hunter.utils.file.writer.write_file
  - cache DebugSession instances by normalized output_file to reuse sessions
  - update example usage to demonstrate file+stdout logging
- update utils exports to include realpath
- tidy imports related to the above changes
feat(proxy-checker): implement ProxyChecker UI

fix(sqlitehelper): use per-operation cursors and normalize execute params

- Remove shared `self.cursor`; create and close a local cursor for each DB
  operation (create_table, insert, select, count, update, delete,
  execute_query, truncate_table, dump_database_truncate).
- Normalize parameters passed to `cursor.execute()` (convert lists to tuples)
  to avoid sqlite3.InterfaceError / "bad parameter or other API misuse".
- Add debug logging in `select` to print SQL and parameter shapes when an
  InterfaceError occurs (helps diagnose bad param usage from callers).
- Fix `dump_database_truncate` nesting/indentation and ensure cursor is
  closed in a finally block.
- Avoid creating/closing a cursor in `close()`; close the connection directly.

No functional change to SQL semantics; this hardens SQLiteHelper for
multithreaded use and prevents recursive cursor reuse errors.
feat(settings): add save_text and load_text functions for QSettings management
feat(script): add python-pyside.cmd to fix PySide6 installation in existing venv

chore(scripts): add repo-root py.cmd wrapper to forward to bin\py.cmd

Adds `py.cmd` at the repository root which forwards execution to `bin\py.cmd`.
This ensures running `py` from the project root uses the project's virtual environment
on Windows (forwards all arguments to the project venv launcher).

refactor(file): extract size utilities to file/size.py and clean exports

- Move `count_lines_in_file`, `size_of_list_in_mb`, and `is_file_larger_than_kb`
  from `packages/proxy-hunter-python/proxy_hunter/utils/file/others.py` to a new
  module `packages/proxy-hunter-python/proxy_hunter/utils/file/size.py`.
- Update `packages/proxy-hunter-python/proxy_hunter/utils/file/__init__.py` to
  import these helpers from `.size` instead of `.others`.
- Remove unused imports (e.g. `sys`) and duplicate `shutil` import from
  `others.py`; tidy up remaining imports.
- Internal refactor only — no behavior changes or breaking API changes.

refactor(utils): move `remove_non_ascii` to ansi module and update imports

- Add `remove_non_ascii` implementation to `utils/ansi.py`
- Remove duplicate implementations from `utils/file/others.py`
- Update exports in `utils/__init__.py` and `utils/file/__init__.py`
- Adjust imports to reference the new location
- Clean up redundant definitions and comments

refactor(utils): reorganize file utilities into submodules

- Split `proxy_hunter/utils/file` into a package with clear submodules:
  - Added `file/__init__.py` (clean exports)
  - Added `file/copy.py`, `file/delete.py`, `file/folder.py`, `file/permissions.py`, `file/read.py`, `file/writer.py`
  - Renamed legacy `file.py` → `file/others.py` and kept non-moved helpers there
- Extracted MD5 helper to `proxy_hunter/utils/md5.py` and updated top-level `utils` exports to import it
- Moved JSON/file writer helpers to `file/writer.py`
- Moved permission helpers to `file/permissions.py` and folder helpers to `file/folder.py`
- Updated `proxy_hunter/utils/__init__.py` and `proxy_hunter/utils/file/__init__.py` to reflect new exports
- Updated `.gitignore` to allow packaging of `__init__.py` files and preserve `proxy_hunter/ip_ranges_US.txt`
- Added unit tests: `packages/proxy-hunter-python/tests/delete_path.py`

Reason: improve modularity, readability and testability of file-related utilities by splitting a large module into focused, importable submodules. No intended breaking changes (exports adjusted to remain available).

refactor(proxyWorking): improve structure, locking, and background execution handling

- add CoreDB initialization and remove unused globals
- reorganize script into clear init, CLI, locking, and execution sections
- replace custom OS detection with PHP_OS_FAMILY
- improve background command generation using sprintf
- ensure lock directories exist and centralize lock paths
- replace global shutdown cleanup with closure-based handler
- clean up working proxies printing logic
- unify file permission handling using consistent paths
feat(proxylist): update badge key and format text to uppercase for better visibility
feat(func_date): add convert_rfc3339_to_datetime function for parsing RFC 3339 timestamps
feat(proxydb): enhance get_working_proxies to support limit and randomization options
feat(proxydb): add debug option to extract_proxies for enhanced logging

feat(config): add explicit sqlite/mysql connection parameters to ConfigDB constructor

- Add explicit constructor parameters: `db_path`, `host`, `user`, `password`, `database` and wire them into sqlite/mysql connection logic.
- Expand constructor docstring with parameter descriptions and usage examples.
- Make dataclass encoding safer (only call `asdict` for instances) and make `_decode` tolerant of `bytes` and non-string DB values.
- Make `get()` tolerant of both `sqlite3.Row` and mysql dict row shapes when reading `value`.

Preserves backward compatibility: the existing `driver` kwarg is still supported (no breaking change).
feat(proxydb): enhance get_untested_proxies to support randomization option

feat(proxydb): add MySQL backend support and MySQL-only tests

- Add MySQL support to `ProxyDB` via `MySQLHelper` and allow selecting backend with
  new constructor args: `db_type`, `mysql_host`, `mysql_dbname`, `mysql_user`, `mysql_password`.
- Accept helper instances directly (SQLiteHelper | MySQLHelper) and defer sqlite path
  when using MySQL.
- Initialize backend in `start_connection()`; load MySQL schema if `assets/mysql-schema.sql` exists.
- Make SQL placeholder and random-function backend-aware:
  use `%s` / `RAND()` for MySQL and `?` / `RANDOM()` for SQLite across methods
  (meta/select/add/remove/update/get_untested/get_dead/get_private/get_working, etc.).
- Add `is_already_added`, `mark_as_added`, `get_random_function`, `normalize_proxy`.
- Extend `get_all_proxies()` to support `limit`, `randomize`, and pagination (`page`, `per_page`)
  while remaining backwards-compatible for simple `limit` usage.
- Minor typing fixes (use `cast` for sqlite path) to satisfy type checkers.
- Add `tests/ProxyDB_MySQL_Test.py` (MySQL-only tests) and load `.env` in `tests/ProxyDB_Test.py`.

BREAKING CHANGE:
- `ProxyDB.__init__` signature changed (new positional/keyword params). Callers using positional arguments
  should switch to keyword args for `db_type` and the MySQL connection params.
- `get_all_proxies()` signature changed (now accepts `limit`, `randomize`, `page`, `per_page`);
  update any callers that relied on the old `rand` positional parameter.

feat(build): add --force flag to override checksum checks and force rebuild

- Integrate `minimist` to parse CLI arguments.
- Add `--force` option to bypass cached checksums.
- Always run yarn install/build and rewrite checksum files when forced.
- Refactor checksum loading logic to respect force mode.
- Improve logging for forced and normal execution paths.

feat(dashboard): replace UserActivityCard with new UserPaymentLogs component

- Add new `UserPaymentLogs` component with merged transaction view, collapsible sections, and multi-page log fetching
- Render payment logs in Dashboard's activity tab and comment out deprecated `UserActivityCard`

feat(logs): add GET-based pagination overrides and structured pagination metadata

- Add offset calculation and apply pagination to "me" user logs
- Decode JSON `details` field per log entry before returning paginated results
- Return detailed pagination metadata (`page`, `per_page`, `offset`, `count`, `total`)
- Update admin logs endpoint to support GET overrides and unified pagination response structure

feat(utils): add isEmpty helper and improve isNotEmpty docs

- Introduce `isEmpty(data)` to standardize emptiness checks across types:
  - treats null/undefined, empty or whitespace-only strings, empty arrays,
    and plain objects with no own enumerable keys as empty.
  - notes caveat for non-plain object types (Map, Set, Date, etc).
- Update `isNotEmpty` to delegate to `isEmpty` (returns the negation).
- Expand and clarify JSDoc comments and examples for both functions.

This improves reuse and consistency when checking for empty values.

feat(data): add hideArrayData helper to recursively mask array values

- Add `src/utils/data/hideArrayData.php`: a recursive utility to hide/mask values in nested arrays based on a user-provided callback.
- Supports callbacks with 2 or 3 args (key, value[, parentKey]); uses reflection to detect and preserve backward compatibility.
- Provides a default mask callback (stars for strings, "[HIDDEN]" otherwise).
- Preserves parent context for object properties inside numeric lists (for sensible parentKey propagation).
- Includes a CLI example demonstrating common sensitive-field masks and how to restore results.
- No breaking changes; purely additive utility and examples.

feat(utils): add runtime type detection helpers

- Add new file `src/utils/data/detection.ts` providing small, documented type-guard helpers:
  `isObject`, `isArray`, `isString`, `isNumber`, `isBoolean`, `isFunction`.
- Functions include JSDoc and use narrow type predicates to help runtime checks and TypeScript inference.

No behavioral changes; utility functions for safer type checks and clearer code.feat(utils): add runtime type detection helpers

- Add new file `src/utils/data/detection.ts` providing small, documented type-guard helpers:

feat(artisan): add CLI proxyChecker to test HTTP/SOCKS proxies and update DB

Add new CLI script `artisan/proxyChecker.php` that accepts `--proxy "IP:PORT"` or
`"IP:PORT@user:pass"` and performs protocol checks for `http`, `socks4`,
`socks5`, `socks4a`, and `socks5h`. For each protocol the checker tries an HTTPS
endpoint first and falls back to an HTTP endpoint. Results for all tested
protocols are aggregated and persisted to the project `ProxyDB`:

- Adds `artisan/proxyChecker.php`.
- CLI-only; exits if not run from CLI.
- Parses optional proxy credentials in `IP:PORT@user:pass` form.
- Tests protocols: `http`, `socks4`, `socks5`, `socks4a`, `socks5h`.
- Tries endpoints per protocol: HTTPS first (https://www.example.com), then
  HTTP fallback (http://httpforever.com/).
- Aggregates working protocols into `type` (e.g. `socks4-socks5`), sets
  `status = active`, stores best `latency` (min), `private` flag, and `https`
  support. Records `anonymity` (when available) and invokes geoip lookup
  best-effort.
- Marks proxy as `port-closed` when port is unreachable or `dead` otherwise.
- Reuses existing helpers from `php_backend/shared.php` and `func-proxy.php`
  (`checkProxy`, `get_anonymity`, `GeoIpHelper`, `ProxyDB`).
- Non-breaking addition; improves proxy validation coverage for multiple
  proxy types and both SSL/non-SSL endpoints.

No breaking changes; purely additive CLI tooling.

feat(server): resolve public IP when REMOTE_ADDR is localhost and cache results

- When `$_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR']` is `127.0.0.1`, call `getPublicIP()` to obtain the machine's public IP
- Add `getPublicIP()` with:
  - in-memory and file caching (1 hour expiry)
  - multiple fallback IP services with short timeouts for fast failover
  - pre-configured cURL options for reliability
- Add `parseIpResponse()` to handle text/json/trace responses and validate IPs
- Add `cacheIp()` helper to persist IP to file and update in-memory cache

This improves accuracy for detecting client/server public IPs in local environments and reduces external calls via caching.

  - Includes examples and clear JSDoc
- Add extensive unit tests in `tests/utils/fixPhoneNumber.test.js` covering:

refactor(workflows): replace github-actions-init.cjs with setup.js

- Updated GitHub Actions workflows to run `node setup.js` instead of `node github-actions-init.cjs`
- Removed legacy `github-actions-init.cjs` script
- Extended `setup.js` to handle dependency installation and checksum verification
- Preserved Tailwind build, index.html copy, and browserslist-db update tasks

feat(ci): improve GitHub Actions dependency setup and add checksum-based install

- Replace direct `yarn install` step in GitHub Actions with a custom setup using `github-actions-init.cjs`
- Refactor `github-actions-init.cjs` to use `spawnSync` instead of `execSync` for better process control
- Expand required packages to include `upath` and `fs-extra`
- Add checksum comparison for `package.json` to trigger `yarn install` only when dependencies change
- Store and update checksum in `tmp/checksum.txt` to avoid unnecessary installs
- Improve logging and error handling for dependency installation
